p: The results of the simulation for the total infected number I( t) = I 1( t) + I 2( t) + E 1( t) + E 2( t) are presented in Fig 2. We choose the intra-cohort transmission rates β 11 = β 22 = 2 to be much larger than β 12 = β 21 = 0.01, the inter-cohort transmission rates; thus, the inter-cohort spread occurs on a much longer time scale than the spread within the cohort. The time for the exposed fraction to become infectious 1/ σ = 2 days, and the recovery time of the infectious fraction 1/ ν = 2 days are close to those in the agent-based model discussed above.
